| **Resistances [conveyed](/wiki/Corpse "Corpse")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        | [cold](/wiki/Cold "Cold"), [poison](/wiki/Poison "Poison")                                                                                              |

| The first wraithworm:* can [swim](/wiki/Swim "Swim").
* can [phase](/wiki/Phase "Phase") through walls.
* cannot pick up items.
* has no hands.
* has no limbs.
* is an [animal](/wiki/Animal "Animal").
* has a [serpent body](/wiki/Slithy "Slithy").
* can [lay eggs](/wiki/Oviparous "Oviparous").
* is [poisonous](/wiki/Poisonous "Poisonous") to eat.
* is [carnivorous](/wiki/Carnivore "Carnivore").
* is normally generated [hostile](/wiki/Hostile "Hostile").
* is [nasty](/wiki/M2_NASTY "M2 NASTY").
* resists [level drain](/wiki/Level_drain "Level drain").
* cannot be [tamed](/wiki/Scroll_of_taming "Scroll of taming").
* [does not move](/wiki/Sessile "Sessile"). |                                                                                                                                                         |

The **First Wraithworm** is the mid-boss of the [Mithardir Quest](/wiki/Mithardir_Quest "Mithardir Quest"). Though stationary, it's positioned in the center of a room scaled such that it can reach every square with its bite attack.

In addition to its other properties, 50% of melee attacks will fail to affect the Wraithworm, passing harmlessly through instead. The First Wraithworm also creates a "windstorm" effect that flings the character around randomly, dealing light damage, forcing them to skip turns, and further frustrating melee combatants.
html:
First Wraithworm

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
S first wraithworm (No tile)
Difficulty 13
Attacks Five-square-reach bite 1d8 life drain, Single-target (active) gaze attack 2d4 paralysis
S first wraithworm (No tile)
Difficulty 13
Attacks

Five-square-reach bite 1d8 life drain, Single-target (active) gaze attack 2d4 paralysis

Base level 10
Base experience 327
Speed 12
Base AC 3
Base MR 0
Alignment -10 (chaotic)
Frequency (by normal means) 0 (Not randomly generated)
Genocidable Yes
Weight 150
Nutritional value 80
Size gigantic
Resistances cold, poison, level drain
Resistances conveyed cold, poison

The first wraithworm:

  • can swim.
  • can phase through walls.
  • cannot pick up items.
  • has no hands.
  • has no limbs.
  • is an animal.
  • has a serpent body.
  • can lay eggs.
  • is poisonous to eat.
  • is carnivorous.
  • is normally generated hostile.
  • is nasty.
  • resists level drain.
  • cannot be tamed.
  • does not move.

The First Wraithworm is the mid-boss of the Mithardir Quest. Though stationary, it's positioned in the center of a room scaled such that it can reach every square with its bite attack.

In addition to its other properties, 50% of melee attacks will fail to affect the Wraithworm, passing harmlessly through instead. The First Wraithworm also creates a "windstorm" effect that flings the character around randomly, dealing light damage, forcing them to skip turns, and further frustrating melee combatants.

Retrieved from "https://nethackwiki.com/index.php?title=First_Wraithworm&oldid=130097"

The '''First Wraithworm''' is the mid-boss of the [[Mithardir Quest]].  Though stationary, it's positioned in the center of a room scaled such that it can reach every square with its bite attack.

In addition to its other properties, 50% of melee attacks will fail to affect the Wraithworm, passing harmlessly through instead.  The First Wraithworm also creates a "windstorm" effect that flings the character around randomly, dealing light damage, forcing them to skip turns, and further frustrating melee combatants.
